results.title: Here to Fall
results.creator_credit: Jim Agnew, Kris Kelly, Evelyn McGrath, Blacknorth, Arts Council (Ireland) and Irish Film Board
results.brief_description: A girl falls through darkness. A signal is broadcast, it’s a call. City wires connect and vibrate. The digital signal holds her, dropping her to a city’s rooftops that builds around her. She recognises it, and she’s safe, but for how long?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Agnew, Kris Kelly, Evelyn McGrath, Blacknorth, Arts Council (Ireland) and Irish Film Board

results.title: Good Night
results.creator_credit: Una Gunjak, Muriel D'Ansembourg, Eva Sigurdardottir, Blindeye Films and London Film School
results.brief_description: Rachel and Chloe are done with being innocent 14-year-olds. They head into town on a secret night out, dressed way beyond their years and oozing a sexuality they barely own.

results.title: Abuelas
results.creator_credit: Katherine Lee, Afarin Eghbal, Kasia Malipan and National Film and Television School (Great Britain)
results.brief_description:
Between 1976 and 1983 Argentina was under a military regime that launched a campaign of terror (now known as the ‘Dirty War’) in which 30,000 people ‘disappeared’.
Among them were children and pregnant women. An estimated 500 babies were born in concentration camps. Whilst the mothers were killed, the children were adopted out, in many cases to military families.
For over 30 years, the ‘Las Abuelas de Plaza de la Mayo’ (‘Grandmothers of the Plaza de Mayo’) have been campaigning to recover these lost grandchildren. Since 2011 over 100 have been found and regained their true identities.
The Abuelas continue to search for the rest.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Katherine Lee, Afarin Eghbal, Kasia Malipan and National Film and Television School (Great Britain)

For over 30 years, the ‘Las Abuelas de Plaza de la Mayo’ (‘Grandmothers of the Plaza de Mayo’) have been campaigning to recover these lost grandchildren. Since 2011 over 100 have been found and regained their true identities.

Among them were children and pregnant women. An estimated 500 babies were born in concentration camps. Whilst the mothers were killed, the children were adopted out, in many cases to military families.
For over 30 years, the ‘Las Abuelas de Plaza de la Mayo’ (‘Grandmothers of the Plaza de Mayo’) have been campaigning to recover these lost grandchildren. Since 2011 over 100 have been found and regained their true identities.

results.title: The Lost Thing
results.creator_credit: Leo Baker, Shaun Tan, Sophie Byrne, Andrew Ruhemann and Passion Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in a city overrun by bureaucracy, this Oscar Award winning animated short film of Shaun Tan’s picture book ‘The Lost Thing’, tells the story of a boy who befriends a strange creature that doesn’t appear to fit in any of the available pigeonholes.

results.title: The Long road to independence
results.creator_credit: Mohammed Abdur Rahman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Serving in the Australian army in East Timor, Mohammed Abdur Rahman and his fellow soldiers were attacked by the Indonesian army many times and involved in some highly publicized events. Over time, Rahman became quite connected to the nation and its people, performing humanitarian work and witnessing East Timor’s struggle towards independence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mohammed Abdur Rahman, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Serving in the Australian army in East Timor, Mohammed Abdur Rahman and his fellow soldiers were attacked by the Indonesian army many times and involved in some highly publicized events. Over time, Rahman became quite connected to the nation and its people, performing humanitarian work and witnessing East Timor’s struggle towards independence.

results.creator_credit: John Croxford, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
